com.googlecode.biscotti.collect

Class TreeBoundedDeque<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.TreeQueue<E>
          • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.TreeDeque<E>
            • com.googlecode.biscotti.collect.TreeBoundedDeque<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements held in this deque
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundedQueue<E>, SortedCollection<E>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.Deque<E>, java.util.Queue<E>

    public final class TreeBoundedDeque<E>
extends TreeDeque<E>
implements BoundedQueue<E>
    An implementation of BoundedQueue backed by a TreeDeque. The elements of this deque are sorted according to their natural ordering, or by an explicit Comparator provided at creation. Inserting null elements is prohibited. Attempting to insert non-comparable elements will result in a ClassCastException.

    The first element (the head) of this deque is considered to be the least element with respect to the specified ordering. Elements with equal priority are ordered according to their insertion order.

    When the deque is full the add(E), offer(E), and addAll(Collection) operations behave according to the following policy: if the element to be added has higher priority than the lowest priority element currently in the deque, the new element is added and the lowest priority element is removed; else the new element is rejected. This implementation maintains references to the highest and lowest elements in the deque; rejecting an element is an O(1) operation.

    Bounded priority queues are useful when implementing n-best algorithms (e.g. finding the best n elements in an arbitrary collection).

    This deque is not thread-safe. If multiple threads modify this deque concurrently it must be synchronized externally.

    Refer to TreeDeque for details of the underlying implementation.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • create

        public static <E> TreeBoundedDeque<E> create(java.lang.Iterable<? extends E> elements)
        Creates a new TreeBoundedDeque containing the elements of and having the maximum size equal to the number of elements in the specified Iterable. If the specified iterable is an instance of SortedSet, PriorityQueue, or SortedCollection this deque will be ordered according to the same ordering. Otherwise, this deque will be ordered according to the natural ordering of its elements.
        Parameters:
        elements - the iterable whose elements are to be placed into the deque
        Returns:
        a new TreeBoundedDeque containing the elements of the specified iterable
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if elements of the specified iterable cannot be compared to one another according to the priority deque's ordering
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the elements of the specified iterable or the iterable itself is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified iterable is empty

      • add

        public boolean add(E e)
        Inserts the specified element into this deque if it is possible to do so immediately without violating capacity restrictions, returning true upon success and throwing an IllegalStateException if no space is currently available.

        This implementation returns true if offer succeeds, else throws an IllegalStateException.

        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Collection<E>
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Deque<E>
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Queue<E>
        Overrides:
        add in class java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        Parameters:
        e - the element to add
        Returns:
        true (as specified by Collection.add(E))
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this deque is full and the element to be added has equal or lower priority than the element at the tail of this deque

      • offer

        public boolean offer(E e)
        Inserts the specified element into this deque if it is possible to do so immediately without violating capacity restrictions. When using a capacity-restricted deque, this method is generally preferable to add(E), which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an exception.
        Specified by:
        offer in interface java.util.Deque<E>
        Specified by:
        offer in interface java.util.Queue<E>
        Overrides:
        offer in class TreeQueue<E>
        Parameters:
        e - the element to add
        Returns:
        true if the element was added to this queue, if this deque is full and the element to be added has equal or lower priority than the element at the head of this deque
